result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald W Schlieger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

DE will complete the Domestic Abuse Intervention program at Anchor Bay counseling.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, pay DOM assessment.

DE will have credit for 10 days if revoked. 

2022GF47 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CM31

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
02:35 PM Attorney Annette M Barna appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. . Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video means for Defendant Donald W Schlieger. Defendant Donald W Schlieger in court. Cases 21CM70 and 21CM91 are set for plea/sentencing.   Case 22CM31 set for INIT.  Parties have reached an agreement.   Case settlement and Guilty Plea Questionnaire filed with the Court.   DE pled entered into the following agreement:
21CM70:  DE plead NC to Ct 1 and Ct 2 with the domestic enh.   Ct 3 Dismissed but R/I for sentencing purposes
21CM91:  DE plead NC to Ct 2 with domestic enh.  Cts 1, 3 and 4 Dismissed but R/I for sentencing purposes
22CM31:  DE plead NC to Ct 3 with domestic enh.  Cts 1 and2 Dismissed but R/I for sentencing purposes
Court informed DE of his rights.   DE understands his rights.  Court informed DE of the elements of the offenses and maximum penalties.    DE understands elements and penalties.  Attorney Rockow stipulated to factual basis to accept pleas.  Court accepts stipulation and finds factual basis for the pleas.  
Victim made a statement to the Court.
State made a sentencing argument.    Attorney Rockow made a sentencing argument.   Victim made a statement as to absolute sobriety.  DE made a statement.   
Court ordered W/H sentence, 2 years probation, DAIP, cannot   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Court ordered domestic abuse assessments and court costs.    Court ordered jail credit as stated on case settlement.   Adj. 3:09 p.m.
No contact with AK, the child, or VK.  If visitation with the child is desired this will be this will be accomplished with an outside agency, approved by the court,  for any visitation of the child.

1:51PM DE appears from RC Jail, Atty K Cook appears.  State appears by DA Barna.  Victims are appearing via phone. AK would like the no contact to remain, but would like DE to be allowed to visit his daughter, with her mother supervising visitations.   State would like the no contact with VK, AK and the child to remain.  Atty Cook asking for a sign bond, State would not object to sign bond with the no contacts in place.  $2500.00 sign bond, no contact with AK, the child or VK.  If visitation of the child is desired this will be thru supervised visits with an outside agency that the court finds appropriate for accomplishing these visitations. Adj 1:59PM
